We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s history of bone marrow transplant, immunosuppressive medications, and symptoms suggest a viral or fungal infection. The positive pp65 antigen test and negative galactomannan antigen test suggest cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection. Ganciclovir is the appropriate pharmacotherapy for CMV infection. Azithromycin is used to treat bacterial infections, while levofloxacin is used for respiratory tract infections. Acyclovir is used to treat viral infections such as herpes simplex virus or varicella-zoster virus, but not necessarily for CMV.
